title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include the description that (ecosystem) resilience/it will be greater (with increased biodiversity).
The response includes the description that (ecosystem) resilience/it will be greater (with increased biodiversity).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable justification. Acceptable justifications include the following.

  • These are the normal/current conditions at which the embryos develop and were used as a basis for comparison.

  • These (current) conditions were used as a basis to compare the effects of changes in environmental conditions/increases in temperature and CO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaaIYaaabeaaaaa@3B7C@ .

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not state an acceptable null hypothesis. Acceptable null hypotheses include the following.

  • Climate change will have no effect on sand lance (embryo) survival/sand lance development/the size of sand lance populations.

  • (Increases in) temperature/ CO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaaIYaaabeaaaaa@3B7C@ levels will have no effect on sand lance (embryo) survival/sand lance development /the size of sand lance populations.

  • There will be no difference in the sand lance (embryo) survival rates/sand lance development/the size of sand lance populations measured at all/different temperatures and CO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaaIYaaabeaaaaa@3B7C@ levels.

The response states an acceptable null hypothesis. Acceptable null hypotheses include the following.

  • Climate change will have no effect on sand lance (embryo) survival/sand lance development/the size of sand lance populations.

  • (Increases in) temperature/ CO 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaaIYaaabeaaaaa@3B7C@ levels will have no effect on sand lance (embryo) survival/sand lance development /the size of sand lance populations.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include support for the student’s claim. Acceptable support includes the following.

  • There will be a negative effect on other trophic levels because the sand lance provides food for many other species.

  • There will be a negative effect on other trophic levels because there will be reduced energy to transfer (to higher trophic levels).

The response includes support for the student’s claim. Acceptable support includes the following.

  • There will be a negative effect on other trophic levels because the sand lance provides food for many other species.

  • There will be a negative effect on other trophic levels because there will be reduced energy to transfer (to higher trophic levels).
